translation:
Most Illustrious Sir

Having D. Antônio Casas delivered, according to the Government's order, to the collector Vasco Amaro the amount of five thousand nine hundred and forty-five pesos, thus exceeding by 945 pesos the five thousand that Your Lordship Casas gave on the second of November last, it is necessary that Your Lordship [account for] nine hundred and forty-five pesos, having the proper receipt for its discharge and to be accounted for in the Treasury.

God keep Your Lordship
Piratini, December 15, 1838.
Bento Gonçalves da Silva

Most Illustrious Sir Joaquim Pereira Fagundes
Police Commander of Bagé.
Bagé, January 30, 1839.

Received from Mr. Antônio Casas. It is in order.
Joaquim Pereira Fagundes. It is in order.
The chief officer and secretary.
Antônio Belarmino Ribeiro.
